tweets.text:
Community of #NewcastleUnderLyme invited to an online engagement event on Weds 26 May at 4pm

If you're affected by odour from #WalleysQuarry it's a chance to find out about our regulation of the site, ask us questions & for us to hear from you

Details ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/2RIZhtFy3Z https://t.co/EuQy5giryf
@SarahWhild @EnvAgency Pretty picture harvested from a photo archive!

It‚Äôs #InvasiveSpecies week!
Invasive non-native species reduce the ability of native wildlife to cope with other pressures such as climate change & habitat loss. 
This week we‚Äôll be sharing content about invasive non-native species &what you can do to help 
#INNSweek @InvasiveSp https://t.co/fa8JScmR2U

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency You're still allowing us to be poisoned by hydrogen sulphide though aren't you James. Even with overwhelming evidence that is causing ill health, you're still doing nothing about it.

@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids You speak for me,can't take anymore disappointing stalling waffle on measures that they know won't work, if she's shutting it down shed say so, anything else means we're still gassed. tweets.text: @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids So how will this work @ClareDinnisEA? You talk down the phone at us for 20 minutes then a select few get to ask a question? Why not zoom? Better still we are organising our own community meeting, why not just come and speak to the people in person?

If we were in the USA, their EPA would have advised staying indoors and protecting the elderly and children when the H2S from #WalleysQuarry hit its peak over just ten minutes. I wonder how they'd respond to repeated exposure over months @EnvAgency 

#StopTheStink https://t.co/NDvQCA2BSO

urls.title: Invasive Species Week - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: It's Invasive Species Week! Throughout the week lots of events and activities will be taking place that people can take part in online or socially distanced. We know that many have been finding solace in nature over the last year, and we will be sharing some simple tips to help you protect the environment. Follow along at @InvasiveSp (external link) or #INNSweek to be added to the mailing list for updates. Take a look at all the activities and materials that have been released this week, and see a list of

tweets.text:
It‚Äôs national invasive species week highlighting the threat to ecology & wildlife of our rivers and lakes. This is a top mouth gudgeon which can eat eggs & larvae of native #fish. 
Make sure you check, clean & dry equipment after use to stop spread #INNS 
https://t.co/EglaQ6mNf6 https://t.co/0RbLTQxdKy

tweets.text:
@a_merrydew @EnvAgencyMids Hi Aimee, we are definitely planning more events. As soon as possible they'll be in person but if necessary we'll run another virtual one. 

A recording / transcript of this week's will be available afterwards so you'll also be able to see if someone else has asked your question.

@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids Thanks for organising this Q&A session. Will there be another one in the near future for people who can't make this session at such short notice? I'm sure many people will have questions and concerns they want to raise.

Could you comment please @CentreEnvHealth @ICRP @cabotinstitute @theGEF we are experiencing nightly levels of H2S above @WHO levels but the @EnvAgency will not act @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink #capitoff https://t.co/yyM65aeSZn

We‚Äôre holding a #covidsafe #community session on Wed 26 May to answer residents‚Äô questions & give you the latest on regulation of #WalleysQuarry. 

Details on how to join below üëá

We‚Äôll also make the session available afterwards for those who can‚Äôt join on the day. https://t.co/njxpZMmOOL

urls.title: Pistia stratoides Floating Pond Plant ¬£15.95 From Mr Fothergills Seeds
urls.description: Pistia stratoides Floating Pond Plant spreads by sending out runners to form young plants. The fine roots give good cover for small fish. Pistia are not hardy and do best placed in sheltered pools. Remove decaying plants after first frost. Very hard to overwinter as they must be placed

urls.title: Testing and sequencing of sewage ramped up to help tackle COVID-19 outbreaks
urls.description: The innovative programme to test wastewater for traces of coronavirus (COVID-19) has ramped up sequencing capacity to support variant detection.

@KilbanePete @AndrewWaller1 @HelenRo94727498 @katerav @EnvAgencyYNE @jnbentley @CityofYork @YorkCycle @Fr_RowntreePark @JonnyPolitics @AndyDAgorne @RosieMicklegate @GarethDennis @YorkLabourCllrs Action is needed indeed! Valid safety concerns raised in the first week of this apparently well prepared scheme. @CityofYork @EnvAgencyYNE and Bentleys need to investigate and take action asap to keep our walkers/ cyclists - the majority and vulnerable users of this area - safe.

@AndrewWaller1 @YorkBikeBelles @HelenRo94727498 @katerav @EnvAgencyYNE @jnbentley @CityofYork @YorkCycle @Fr_RowntreePark @JonnyPolitics @AndyDAgorne @RosieMicklegate @GarethDennis We've talked about this till the cows came home & went back out again. domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Great British Railway Journeys
entity.description: Cartographer George Bradshaw produced the first comprehensive timetable and travel guide of Great Britain's railway system in 1840. Armed with his Bradshaw's Guide, presenter Michael Portillo travels around the country by train exploring the ways that society and industry have changed since the guide was first published during the Victorian era. In each destination Michael visits local landmarks, meets residents, enjoys local food, and tries his hand at local crafts and manufacture, and considers the legacy of the industrial revolution as he makes he way across the country.
